translation.translation: A layout for the Cascade coaster
Inspired by the Fairytale theme this park entrance will fit as a nice gateway to your fantasy land.
Inspired by the Fairytale theme this park entrance will fit as a nice gateway to your fantasy land.
A layout for the Hop The Gaps coaster
Expecting more guests to your great looking park? Try upgrading the main entrance in a Planet Coaster style!
A modern air conditioned staff building.
The perfect start for your Pirate themed park.
Pirate themed food and drink shops
A fortified staff building for land lubbers.
A cool and quiet resting place for overworked staff.
No moonbase park would be complete without this food outlet. Spacemen get hungry too!
No moonbase park would be complete without this drinks outlet. Spacemen get thirsty too!
The perfect start for your Sci-fi themed park.
The perfect start for your Sci-fi themed park.
An empty shopfront for your Sci-fi themed park.
An empty shopfront for your Sci-fi themed park.
Sci-fi themed food and drink shops
Ain't no finer start to a Western themed park than this.
A Western themed first aid station.
A layout for the Zenith coaster
Will you give the lovable T. Rex a hand? He's only got short arms!
You collected all the Bronze stars for 'Gulpee's Island Paradise'.
You collected all the Silver stars for 'Gulpee's Island Paradise'.
You collected all the Gold stars for 'Gulpee's Island Paradise'.
You have completed every objective in 'Gulpee's Island Paradise'!

Gulpee wants to turn this remote beachfront into a theme park, but he has no idea how to go about it. Can you help? It’s going to take skilful management and a full staff roster to keep everything running smoothly.
Gulpee makes great sodas but he isn’t great at building theme parks. Can you help him out?
A coaster that combines a boat ride with a roller coaster.
Classic wooden coaster with only two sets of wheels.
Steel accelerator coaster that is propelled by a hydraulic launch mechanism.
Ride under cover on this vintage family ride. Gentle Ride
Ride under cover on this vintage family ride. Gentle Ride

The desired shape of this Crowd Blocker
Destinations advertised by this scenery piece
Multi-select guest destinations to be advertised by this scenery piece
A building within which staff can rest and recover and various staff perks can be selected and applied.
A building within which staff can rest and recover and various staff perks can be selected and applied. The need for staff to take a break can be disabled in the options
Staff Building - Staff energy features are disabled in this parks and these buildings will be unused.
Staff energy features are disabled. Staff will not need a staff building.
Staff energy features are disabled in this park.
Rate at which the guest happiness declines.
If deselected all guests will be cleared from the scenario when it is first loaded.
Opening and closing times determine the light levels within your park.
Bonus to guest spawn rate based on the park rating.
Park height determines how high you can build your roller coasters.
Minimum Park Rating before staff energy loss reaches full effect.
This multiplier determines what amount of a ride or scenery items cost is refunded when it is deleted.
These items will be unlocked at the start of the scenario.
Replace all research with pre-set values.
These items will be locked at the start of the scenario.
These items will not be available in the scenario.
The scenario will start with this amount of money, plus any ongoing loans.
This multiplier determines what amount of a track or tracked rides cost is refunded when it is deleted.
Happiness rating at which vandals will commit crimes.
Chance that each new group of guests will spawn as vandals.
Allow the player to disable track restrictions.
Allow the Player to Change Security Features
Guard Monthly Pay - Spot chance multiplier
Min. number of Guests for Pickpockets
Active loans the player starts out with and has to deal with. A park may have no more than three active loans. Available Loans the player can take out during play.
How likely specific Guest Groups will visit this park
Chance that a guest will spawn with a Trait
Place Guest Spawning Points and edit the boundaries of the park
Park Size, Shape, and Spawn Points
Edit park dimensions and guest spawn points
Allow the Player to Edit the Opening Times
Allow the Player to Edit the Park Capacity
Allow the Player to Edit the Terrain
Remove all clutter on Start (Rubbish, Vomit)
Scenario Starts at a specific Time
Presets let you pick from a list of predefined research setups.
Allow the Player to toggle Staff Features
These settings will apply to all staff regardless of type.
Park Rating threshold for Staff Energy decline
Standard staff settings: • Staff building perks provide normal bonuses. • Staff quit at their normal happiness level. • Staff start at their normal happiness. • Staff stop working at 15% energy.
Easy staff setting: • Staff building perks have a greater effect. • Staff can quit at a lower happiness level. • Staff start at a higher happiness value.

When Entertainers are set to Apathetic:
• Entertainers don't increase guest happiness as much as normal. • Entertainers can entertain less guests at once.

When Entertainers are set to Commercial:
• Entertainers don't increase guest happiness as much as normal. • Entertainers can entertain more guests at once.

When Entertainers are set to default:
• Normal happiness increase for guests. • Normal Time between performances. • Normal amount of guests per performance. • Normal workload levels before Entertainers get stressed. • Normal pay and energy levels.

When Entertainers are set to easy:
• Entertainers increase guest happiness more than normal. • Entertainers can perform more regularly. • Entertainers can handle more workloads. • Entertainers don't tire as quickly.

When Entertainers are set to Energetic:
• Entertainers lose energy at a decreased rate.

When Entertainers are set to entitled:
• Entertainers require more money to keep them happy.

When Entertainers are set to Fatigued:
• Entertainers lose energy at an increased rate.

When Entertainers are set to Grateful:
• Entertainers require less money to keep them happy.

When Entertainers are set to hard:
• Entertainers don't increase guest happiness as much as normal. • Entertainers have a longer delay between performances. • Entertainers get overworked from lower workloads. • Entertainers get tired faster.

When Entertainers are set to lazy:
• Entertainers don't increase happiness of guests as much. • Entertainers have a larger gap between performances.

When Entertainers are set to passionate:
• Entertainers increase guest happiness more than normal. • Entertainers can entertain more guests at once.

When Entertainers are set to get easily stressed:
• Entertainers get overworked from smaller workloads.
Hard staff setting: • Staff building perks have a reduced effect. • Staff can quit at a higher happiness level. • Staff start at lower happiness.

When Janitors are set to Apathetic:
• Janitors are faster at performing tasks.

When Janitors are set to default:
• Normal job durations. • Normal movement speed around the park. • Normal pay range requirements. • Normal energy levels.

When Janitors are set to easy:
• Bins have a higher capacity. • Janitors are faster at performing tasks. • Janitors can handle more workloads. • Janitors don't tire as easily.

When Janitors are set to Energetic:
• Janitors lose energy at a decreased rate.

When Janitors are set to entitled:
• Janitors require more money to keep them happy.

When Janitors are set to Fatigued:
• Janitors lose energy at an increased rate.

When Janitors are set to grateful:
• Janitors require less money to keep them happy.

When Janitors are set to hard:
• Bins have a lower capacity. • Janitors are not as fast at performing tasks. • Janitors get overworked from lower workloads. • Janitors get tired faster.

When Janitors are set to lazy:
• Less effective at cleaning toilets. • Slower at performing tasks. • Slower movement speed.

When Janitors are set to passionate:
• Janitors perform tasks faster. • Janitors move around the park faster.

When Janitors are set to get easily stressed:
• Janitors get overworked from smaller workloads.

When Mechanics are set to Apathetic:
• Mechanics don't increase the durability of rides as much as normal. • Mechanics are faster at performing tasks.

When Mechanics are set to default:
• Normal Inspection/Refurbishment/Repair durations. • Normal Durability gain. • Normal breakdown prevention threshold. • Normal movement speeds around the park. • Normal pay and Energy levels.

When Mechanics are set to easy:
• Lowers the breakdown threshold. • Mechanics are faster at performing tasks. • Mechanics move around the park faster. • Mechanics can handle more workloads. • Mechanics don't tire as easily.

When Mechanics are set to Energetic:
• Mechanics lose energy at a decreased rate.

When Mechanics are set to entitled:
• Mechanics require more money to keep them happy.

When Mechanics are set to Fatigued:
• Mechanics lose energy at an increased rate.

When Mechanics are set to Grateful:
• Mechanics require less money to keep them happy.

When Mechanics are set to hard:
• Raises the breakdown threshold. • Mechanics are not as fast at performing tasks. • Mechanics move around the park slower. • Mechanics get overworked from lower workloads. • Mechanics get tired faster.

When Mechanics are set to lazy:
• Slower at performing tasks. • Slower movement speeds.

When Mechanics are set to passionate:
• Mechanics perform tasks faster. • Mechanics have an increased effect on the durability of rides.

When Mechanics are set to stressed:
• Mechanics get overworked from smaller workloads.
Overtime staff setting: • Staff need less energy to leave the staff building. • Staff stop working at 1% energy.

When Security guards are set to Apathetic:
• Security guards have a lower chance of detecting pickpockets from reports. • Security guards have a smaller radius of detecting crimes.

When Security guards are set to Blind Eye:
• Security guards have a smaller radius of detection.

When Security guards are set to default:
• Normal detection chances per report. • Normal detection radius. • Normal Running speeds and movement speed around the park. • Normal ability to handle workload. • Normal pay requirements and Energy levels.

When Security guards are set to easy:
• Security guards have a larger radius of detecting crimes. • Security guards are faster when giving chase. • Security guards can handle more workloads. • Security guards don't tire as easily.

When Security guards are set to Energetic:
• Security guards lose energy at a decreased rate.

When Security guards are set to entitled:
• Security guards require more money to keep them happy.

When Security guards are set to Fatigued:
• Security guards lose energy at an increased rate.

When Security guards are set to Grateful:
• Security guards require less money to keep them happy.

When Security guards are set to hard:
• Security guards have a smaller radius of detecting crimes. • Security guards are not as fast when giving chase. • Security guards get overworked from lower workloads. • Security guards get tired faster.

When Security guards are set to lazy:
• Slower run speeds. • Slower movement speed around the park. • Tires from sprinting and patrolling faster.

When Security guards are set to passionate:
• Security guards have an increased chance to detect criminals from reports. • Security guards have a larger radius of detecting crimes. • Security guards recover from sprinting faster. • Security guards give chase at an increased rate.

When Security guards are set to get easily stressed:
• Security guards get overworked from smaller workloads.

When Vendors are set to default:
• Normal serving speeds. • Normal effect on on guest happiness. • Normal workload levels before Vendors get stressed. • Normal pay range requirements. • Normal Energy levels.

When Vendors are set to easy:
• Vendors can handle more workloads. • Vendors don't tire as easily. • Vendors are faster at serving guests.

When Vendors are set to Energetic:
• Vendors lose energy at a decreased rate.

When Vendors are set to entitled:
• Vendors require more money to keep them happy.

When Vendors are set to Fast:
• Vendors serve items faster than normal.

When Vendors are set to Fatigued:
• Vendors lose energy at an increased rate.

When Vendors are set to Grateful:
• Vendors require less money to keep them happy.

When Vendors are set to hard:
• Vendors get tired faster. • Vendors get overworked from lower workloads. • Vendors are not as fast at serving guests.

When Vendors are set to lazy:
• Slower serving speeds.

When Vendors are set to passionate:
• Vendors serve guests faster. • Vendors have an increased positive effect on guest happiness.

When Vendors are set to get easily stressed:
• Vendors get overworked from smaller workloads.

When Vendors are set to Work-bot:
• Vendors don't have an effect on guests' happiness. • Vendors are faster at serving guests.
Work Averse staff setting: • A higher level of energy is required before staff will begin to work. • Staff lose more energy performing some work tasks. • Staff stop working at 25% energy.
These settings will change how staff behave on a per-staff type level.

Staff Building Change Cost: {COST:currency} Monthly Running Cost Change: {RunningCost:currency}
Energy features are disabled in this park. Staff will not use this building
Staff resting here will recover energy slightly faster
Entertainers and vendors with this perk will make the guests they interact with even happier
Staff members with this perk gain happiness faster

No staff perk applied
Select a perk to apply to this staff building. Applying a perk will give certain benefits to your staff.
Staff will be more resilient against being overworked
Security staff with this perk will have better detection rates

No staff perk applied
Upgrade your staff building to offer a perk to give staff members who rest there certain benefits.
While resting in the staff building, staff will learn more about their job, bringing their training date forward
Staff will be more resilient against being underworked

Building Scenery Rating
The better your staff buildings look, the more appreciated your staff will feel, recovering energy faster
Select a shop to assign this vendor to
Drops the boat into the water.
Channel of water that pushes the boat along.
Starts lifting the boat uphill and allows a continuous transition into a chain lift.
Lifts the boat out of the water onto normal track.
<font color='accent'>Channel Entry</font> Drops the boat into the water.
<font color='accent'>Water Channel</font> Channel of water that pushes the boat round.
<font color='accent'>Conveyor Belt Chain Lift Start</font> Starts lifting the boat uphill and allows a continuous transition into a chain lift.
<font color='accent'>Conveyor Belt Channel Exit</font> Lifts the boat out of the water onto normal track.
Remove the piece looked at and instead use the facing direction of the vista point
Set a scenery or building piece as the focus for guests to look at
Select piece to be the focus of this vista point
Select a scenery or building piece to be the focus point for guests at this vista point.
Moves the camera when the cursor is at the edge of the screen.

Allows the camera to fly freely around your park. Useful in tight areas or for taking screenshots.
You can use [{#LogicalButton.GameCamera_FreelookMode#}] to toggle Freelook from within the game.
[{#LogicalButton.GameCamera_RotateLeft#}] and [{#LogicalButton.GameCamera_RotateRight#}] will raise and lower the camera height in Freelook.
Allows the camera to move through the terrain
Allows the camera to focus on objects like scenery and buildings in addition to terrain and paths. Focusing on scenery affects camera speed and zoom limitations.

This preset uses Centre Focused options and is most similar to strategy and management games. It works best in flat parks.
Default setting.
This preset uses Mouse Focused options. It works best in parks with complex terrain.
This preset uses a mix of options. It offers precise control but requires careful handling.
Grabs a point in the park and move around that.
Pans the camera based only on the mouse movement.
Grabs a point in the park and moves, rotates, and zooms around the grab point.
Determine what the camera rotates around.
Determine where the camera moves as you zoom in and out.
Dex-R welcomes you to the world of tomorrow!
King Coaster wishes to test your famed skill!
You can now head for the high seas!
Princess Amelie cordially invites you to attend court.
Well done! You collected all the Bronze Stars in the main career!
Congratulations! You collected all the Silver Stars in the main career!
Amazing! You collected all the Gold Stars in the main career!
Wow! You have completed every objective in the main career!
Coasters! Building increasingly difficult coasters to satisfy King Coaster.
They said no one could build a theme park at Molly's Gully. Prove them wrong! Keep below the height restriction and bankroll the construction of a colossal coaster!

The enormous golem's rampage has finally come to an end, frozen in eternal battle against the M.U.T.T.s. Our experts claim the creature is dormant, but local staff don't seem convinced; they're demanding a premium to work here! Utilise the monorail to make the most of the space and create a truly unique sci-fi theme park.

Rumours of engineers meeting sticky ends scared off this park's staff, leading to its recent sale. The bargain price presents an irresistible opportunity, so hire some new staff, complete construction of the park and ignore the reports of strange noises underground. I'm sure it's nothing to worry about...

A strange object found in the desert appears to have exerted an unexpected effect on the park’s rides – everything keeps breaking down and we’re running out of cash. Hire some mechanics, utilise work rosters to fix and maintain the rides, combat the Monolith’s power and get the park back in profit.

The government recently sold off a tract of restricted land to private buyers, which was promptly snapped up by an ambitious theme park operation. Shortly after their grand opening, this sci-fi themed park's management mysteriously disappeared, along with all their research. Keep this park in the black, earn enough to research new rides and make this strange park a success.

This futuristic park's shop franchisors have questioned their long term commitment after underwhelming financial results. Retain their trust by squeezing as much profit as possible from your shops and facilities. Layout and pricing choices are key, and canny tycoons will make use of the ready-built shopfronts.

Avast me hearties, and welcome to Planet Coaster! Shiver those timbers and take charge of this explosive pirate park. Complete ride construction, draw in the crowds and give your guests a swashbuckling good time!

Former Pirate turned entrepreneur Peg-Leg Pete appears to be struggling somewhat; his loan-addled park is incomplete and lacking in fun (if only he could remember where he buried his treasure... It was around here somewhere). Take the helm and turn things around before this ship capsizes!

The Skull? It appeared one day, rising from the earth in search of vengeance, I reckon. Some say it’s cursed but all I know is that it makes people unhappy. We need your help to counteract the skull’s effect or the park will never recover. Keep guests happy and keep them in the park. Hire entertainers, run marketing campaigns, do what you gotta do to keep the money coming in.

The Silversmith family are opening a theme park in the grounds of their estate to tackle their runaway debts. Your job is to build a successful park and keep the place afloat, with just a few caveats... The Silversmiths are rather old fashioned and will only allow ‘traditional’ attractions, so you may want to aim your Marketing efforts at families and ensure your ride sequences offer value for money. Oh, and build carefully, as the estate will take a percentage of any refunds... Good luck!

They say this tree is the heart of the world. Can you respect mother nature and craft an eco-friendly theme park around the towering tree, or will you sell the woodland for profit and squeeze as much as you can from this verdant environment?
Can your skills impress the King of Coasters?
Plunder through these scenarios with Lockjaw. Arrrrr you ready?
Princess Amelie requests your aid in revitalising her kingdom.
Autocomplete not possible between current track ends
Autocomplete not available for this ride
Vertical drop coaster using wide, high capacity floorless cars for an extra feeling of rider vulnerability.
Hypercoaster that's all about airtime and high vertical G forces.
Chain-lift powered coaster that positions riders either side of the track, with nothing above or below them, giving an unparalleled sense of freedom.
Single Rail coaster track that can invert.
Highly versatile coaster featuring an un-paralleled drop angle of 121 degrees, along with chain lift and powered launches.
Inverted Coaster that lends itself to twisting, snaking track designs.
Mine Train themed coaster, with a locomotive styled front car.
LSM powered coaster that positions riders either side of the track, with nothing above or below them, giving an unparalleled sense of freedom.
A coaster with dragon styled cars to thrill both adults and children.
Secures riders in a standing position as they travel along the track.
Wooden coaster with a steel plate added to the upper track layers, allowing it to invert.
Giga coaster that uses a cable lift system.
These coasters feature abnormal banking, past-vertical drops and tight corners.
Steel track and wooden coaster supports combine to create a hybrid coaster that can invert, whilst retaining the look and characteristics of a wooden coaster.
Log Flume water ride, which can be used to build a gentle river ride or a thrill ride with big drops.
Riders sit in carriages that are suspended out to the side of the track and can freely spin longitudinally.
Capable of dizzying heights and drops.
Inverted Coaster where riders are secured below the track.
Restrains riders in a suspended, head first prone position, giving them the sensation of flying along the track.
Accelerates faster than a racing car thanks to a hydraulic launch system.
Features cars that can freely spin on a vertical axis.
X-Dimension coaster where the cabins can be given set rotation angles.
Coaster where the outer seats are positioned over the edge of the track.
Launched coaster which includes a loop with integrated top hat.
Restrains riders in a seated position, with no floor so their legs dangle freely above the track.
A coaster with whale styled cars to thrill both adults and children.
A traditional rollercoaster type that's primarily made of wood, which results in an exciting, rough and wild ride.
Gas powered cars travel along a track at a fixed speed.
Electrically powered cars travel along a track at a fixed speed.

River Rapids water ride, where riders sit in circular boats and travel along fast flowing sections of water.

This undulating track will roll your body and mind! Thrill Ride

Guests love this modern theme park staple. Thrill Ride

Starting cash: $8000
- Many items researched - Guests Happiness drops slowly - Breakdown rate is slow

In harder difficulties you can expect: • Less starting cash. • Fewer items researched. • Guest happiness to drop more quickly. • More frequent breakdowns. • Faster ride reputation decline. • Guests to be harder to attract.

Starting cash: $2000
- Few items researched - Guest Happines drops quickly - Breakdown rate is fast - Ride Reputation declines quickly

Starting cash: $2000
- Few items researched - Guest Happiness drops very quickly - Breakdown rate is fast - Ride Reputation declines very quickly - Guests are harder to attract

Starting cash: $2000
- Few items researched - Guest Happiness drops very quickly - Breakdown rate is fast - Ride Reputation declines very quickly - Guests are harder to attract

Starting cash: $4000
- Some items researched - Guest Happiness drops steadily - Breakdown rate is average - Ride Reputation declines steadily
